com.anotherservice.util

Class I

  • Object
    • I

  • public class I
extends Object

    This class is a very short shortcut for using foreach loops with stuff that don't support it natively. Of course, this is a lazy shortcut because official alternatives exists with regular for or while loops.


    This works :

     Iterable<int> items = new ArrayList<int>();
 for( int i : items )
 {
        // do stuff
 }

    But it doesnt work for Enumerations like Hashtable.keys() for instance, or for any Object[] neither... So you can use the following way :
     Hashtable<int, Object> hash = new Hashtable<int, Object>();
 for( int i : I.iterable(hash.keys()) )
 {
        // do stuff
 }
 
 int[] items = new int[]{ 42 };
 for( int i : I.iterable(items) )
 {
        // do stuff
 }

    Author:
    Simon Uyttendaele

    • Method Detail

      • iterable

        public static final <T> Iterable<T> iterable(Enumeration<T> e)
        Transforms an Enumeration into an Iterable object
        Parameters:
        e - the target enumeration
        Returns:
        a read-only Iterable representation of the provided Enumeration
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if remove() method of the Iterator is called

      • iterable

        public static final <T> Iterable<T> iterable(T[] array)
        Transforms an Array into an Iterable object
        Parameters:
        array - the target object array
        Returns:
        a read-only Iterable representation of the provided Array
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if remove() method of the Iterator is called
